attributes.action: Actively reduce overall vehicle numbers on our roads
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: To achieve the overall objectives of reducing road congestion and reduce the effects of vehicle pollution on the environment, reduce the number of vehilcles on the road by simply instructing the DVLA to limit new vehicle registrations. Only to allow a new registration when two or more cancellations have been logged. No exceptions, to preferential treatment. This could be done without the need for extra staff of or cash resources and more importantly without needing to make the motorist pay. Is this too simple or what?
